content.description: Climb the thin crack and face on the right side of the upper wall. Solid 5.7 start that gets rapidly easier.
content.location: Right side of the upper wall. Right of Left Stuff, the more obvious crack on the upper face.

content.description: Climb the #2 to #5 size flaring crack then finish on the face using the arête. Small nut protection available on the left side of arête, but definitely sketchy.
Climb the main crack on the upper wall. Finger to hand size crack with plenty of nearby face holds. Solid 5.7 start that gets easier as you go up.
content.protection: Top rope. The VA, WV, MA guide lists this as a possible lead, but also warns that the rock is soft.
content.location: Main crack on the upper wall. A small tree is growing out of the top of the crack.

content.description: Gets easier as you get closer to the corner.  Also gets easier once you reach the first small ledge about 10 feet off the balcony.
content.location: Face just to the left of the Balcony Corner.

content.description: Climb the prominent left facing dihedral on the left side of the upper wall. A few small ledges break up the climb.
content.location: This dihedral creates a break between the left and right sections of the upper wall. The finish is just left of Left Stuff, the prominent crack with a small tree at the top.

content.description: Start at the outside corner just to the right of Balcony Corner.  Climb the arête and face just to the right.
content.location: Juliet's Balcony area of Great Falls Park VA

content.description: The upper wall above the balcony contains a lot of classic routes. Some follow obvious features, others offer some face climbing opportunities.
